title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: We all know Mr. Buffett is hater. He used to call Bitcoin a "scam" many times. But I believe people can change. We've seen people like Larry Fink, Michael Saylor, Donald Trump, Mark Cuban, and Robert Kiyosaki change their mind about Bitcoin. They hated it once, only to realize they were wrong.Imagine what will happen if Warren Buffett goes all in BTC. Will his moves be enough to "pump" market prices all the way to Mars? Only time will tell.Do you think Warren Buffett will buy BTC someday? Or will he stay a hater until the bitter end? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

comments.author: AsiaHODL
comments.body: Well, he already owns numerous companies and including banks that have exposure to BTC. So indirectly he already does own.Would Berkshire actually buy? Unlikely (just like they don't buy gold as an asset). But if he ever dies, would Ted and Todd? Yes, I believe they would, and when they do, that will be epic.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: He already owns some bank stocks which are pro crypto. He doesn't really own bitcoin directly. Somehow though, I have a feeling that he already owns btc. He is just shy about telling it because it would make him look bad. Even if he doesn't, like I said, the stocks he owns deal with crypto so he owns btc indirectly and that's as good as owning btc because his stocks benefit from the btc's price actions.Peter Schiff also hates bitcoin but he accepts btc for his gold which is pretty weird. Don't trust these snakes.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on October 28, 2024, 06:44:39 PMDo you think Warren Buffett will buy BTC someday? Or will he stay a hater until the bitter end? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Well, I think Warren Buffett will continue to dislike Bitcoin and he would never change his mindset and buy Bitcoin like the others that you've mentioned in your thread. He's a firm crypto hater and he'll continue with his own approach rather than supporting Bitcoin or any crypto related technologies. He's someone with a mindset of traditional investor and he doesn't really understand the importance of a digital asset like Bitcoin. Still, if we assume that he somehow changes his mind and starts promoting Bitcoin then there's chance that the ones who follow Buffett may invest in Bitcoin and that could really impact the value of Bitcoin in a  good way.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: At this age and wealth, it is difficult for Warren Buffett to change his beliefs and concepts from being a hater to a supporter, and the best that could happen is for him to describe Bitcoin as a bubble or stop criticizing Bitcoin publicly. He has various investments and is definitely an indirect investor in Bitcoin.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Warren is in the twilight of his life. He's 94 years old. He's an old dog. And he's been through it all and ended up successful. I don't think he'll waver on this. Bitcoin simply isn't for him. Ironic as it may seem, however, Warren has indirect exposure to Bitcoin. He's heavily invested in NU Holdings. He trusted the company with hundreds of millions of dollars. He may or may not be aware but he actually trusted a company that offers NU Crypto via NU Bank. Buffet trusts a company that trusts Bitcoin.

Warren Buffett has been greatly known to be a value investor, and he's different from other successful businessmen out there. I still remember when he invested in Coca-Cola a few decades ago. He said that he sees value in it hence, he invested millions of dollars back then. Now he's getting dividends way more than his initial investment. He's investing based on the value, and not just because many are investing into it.Buffett don't see any value with Bitcoin hence, I don't see him investing into it AT ALL. Of course like you said, anybody can change like the ones you said, but for Buffett, he can change anytime, but what are the chances? I don't think that his stance with how he sees Bitcoin will change. Maybe if he sees Bitcoin reaching $100,000 then that's the time where he will change his view about it and then who knows. He might invest into it, but right now, I don't see him doing it.Will the market pump if he suddenly change sides and invests into Bitcoin? Nah, I don't think so... or maybe we will see a temporary pump and then the market will go back to normal.

comments.body: Well, it would be epic if someone like Warren Buffett finally purchases Bitcoin for personal purposes because if there has been anyone who has been so vocal in his staunch hatred for Bitcoin, it is him so just as when these big whales buy Bitcoin and it affects price I believe his will too because I don't think he'd want to purchase a small amount. On another hand, it's quite unlikely for someone who views the digital coin as a virus to just indulge in it even though the Op mentioned individuals who where haters but later turned before him but compared to Warren Buffett, these other guys are saints.
